Title.evidence: CReST2: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Covered and Uncovered Stents in Palliative Colorectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was 1:1 to covered or uncovered stents

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with left-sided colonic obstruction due to incurable malignancy.

Intervention.evidence: Randomisation was 1:1 to covered or uncovered stents

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of covered versus uncovered stents in terms of stent patency and quality of life (QoL).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Co-primary outcomes were stent patency at 6 months and QoL at 3 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was 1:1 to covered or uncovered stents, using a central service with minimization for age, WHO performance status, tumour site, and palliation indication.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients and clinicians, except for the stent inserter.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between June 2017 and April 2022, 377 patients were randomised (188 covered, 189 uncovered).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Stent patency at 6 months was 72.7% for covered and 81.9% for uncovered stents (adjusted HR 1.48, 97.5% CI 0.86â€“2.54).

Harms.evidence: Complications occurred in 26.1% (covered) and 17.5% (uncovered) of patients.

Funding.evidence: The trial was funded by the National Institute for Health Research.
